org.bk.ass.manage

Class Lock<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bk.ass.manage.Lock<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of resource
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ListLock

    public class Lock<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Holds a lock on a resource. Ie. a unit or GMS. For a lock supporting multiple items, use ListLock.

    How to use the lock:

    • Per-Frame mode: Your Reservation should reset every frame. Call acquire() to get the current or new item. Only call release() if you might want to lock some item somewhere else in the same frame. To ensure a new item is retrieved every time, use reacquire().
    • Continuous mode: Your Reservation is "persistent" and will not forget reserved items. If a reserved item is "lost", be sure to call reset(). Call release() to allow another lock to acquire() an item. Never call reacquire(), it will not release any previous item.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Lock

        public Lock(Reservation<T> reservation,
            java.util.function.Supplier<T> selector)

    • Method Detail

      • setFutureFrames

        public void setFutureFrames(int futureFrames)
        When trying to figure out if the lock can be satisfied in the future, uses the given amount of frames. Be sure to update the value or reset it if no longer used!

      • setHysteresisFrames

        public void setHysteresisFrames(int hysteresisFrames)
        Once a lock is satisfiedLater, uses the given amount of frames in addition to the future frames for the next check if the lock can be satisfied in the future. The main purpose it to prevent isSatisfiedLater() from jumping from true to false due to small fluctuations. The default value is 48 frames.

      • setCriteria

        public void setCriteria(java.util.function.Predicate<T> criteria)
        Add a criteria any locked item must meet. This is true for already selected items and for newly selected items. If the selected item does not satisfy the criteria, it will be dropped.

      • getItem

        public T getItem()
        Returns the currently reserved item. To verify that it is locked, call isSatisfied() before!

      • isSatisfied

        public boolean isSatisfied()
        Returns true if there is a locked item available now.

      • isSatisfiedLater

        public boolean isSatisfiedLater()
        Returns true if an item was reserved but is not yet available. If futureFrames is 0, this should match isSatisfied().

      • reacquire

        public void reacquire()
        Drops any current item and tries to acquire a new one. The current item will not be released!

      • release

        public void release()
        Releases the currently reserved item.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets this lock. Any previously reserved item will not be released when using this call.

      • acquire

        public boolean acquire()
        Tries to reserve and lock an item. If the last item reserved was not released, tries to reserve and lock it again. Returns true if an item was reserved and is available immediately.
